channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 25th May

OVERGROWN VEGETATION POOR VISIBILITY AT JUNCTION As cross main road into Andoversford PLEASE STRIM BACK 20 METRES LANE CLOSURE (Embankment & Cuttings)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 25th May
item.description:
ENWD CAN THIS BE RE STRIMMED STILL POOR VISIBILITY Overgrown vegetation please strim 20 METRES 4 X WAY STOP AND GO (Embankment & Cuttings)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Entire road between rail station and arle road, 25th May
item.description:
This stretch of road had been hazardous for YEARS. I don't think there is any original surface left as you head away from the station towards Tesco's. Cheltenham has become much better in recent years for potholes but this road seems to get informed. As a main route into and out of Cheltenham should be completely resurfaced
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 151, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Its a big pot hole on the junction, 24th May
item.description:
You can't miss it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Willowbrook Drive, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: College Fields paviers broken as you enter the road, 24th May
item.description:
The entrance into College Fields has had loose paviers which have been that way for many months. There is a paint mark round the broken section but still no repairs. If the repair isn’t done soon the paviers themselves look destined to break and then there will be more extensive, and I assume more expensive, repairs needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Paygrove Lane, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: End of North Road west,turning onto Badgeworth Lane, junction visibility issue, 24th May
item.description:
End of North Road west, turning out onto Badgeworth Lane. You can’t see the vehicles approaching this junction due to the hedges both sides of this road being so over grown.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extensive mud in road, 24th May
item.description:
Harp Hill is currently closed due to work taking place for a development off Greenway Lane. This is already inconvenient for the general public but to make matters worse, Greenway Lane is covered in mud flowing from the same development. I would suggest lorry wheels are not being washed. The mud is evident day after day.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenway Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
